> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On 
> Behalf O=
f Kent Beck

> I can't think of a simple way to make JUnit 4 work with Java=
 
> 1.4, though.

It's not very hard:  TestNG supports both 1.4 and 1.5 ann=
otations by using
QDox to parse 1.4 annotations:

/**
  * @... grou=
ps =3D "functional db"
  */
public void insertIntoDataBase() { ... }

equiv=
alent to

@Test(groups =3D { "functional", "db" })
public void insertIntoDa=
taBase() { ... }

It takes some effort to structure the code so the parsing=
 is entirely based
on interfaces, but it's well worth it (and an interestin=
g challenge).  But
it's totally transparent for the user (they just need to=
 use a different jar
file depending on whether they want 1.4 or 1.5 annotat=
ions).

-- 
C=E9dric
